data.chText: 提到；写到；说到
data.enText: to write or speak about sth/sb, especially without giving much information

data.chText: 没人跟我提过这事儿。
data.enText: Nobody mentioned anything to me about it.

data.chText: 对不起，我再也不提它了。
data.enText: Sorry, I won't mention it again.

data.chText: 既然你说到这事儿，她确实好像情绪不大对。
data.enText: Now that you mention it , she did seem to be in a strange mood.

data.chText: 有人提到他，认为他将来可以当下院议员。
data.enText: His name has been mentioned as a future MP.

data.chText: 她有没有说起她要去哪儿？
data.enText: Did she mention where she was going?

data.chText: 你在信中谈到你可能要移居国外。
data.enText: You mentioned in your letter that you might be moving abroad.

data.chText: 他没提到是他先动手打人的。
data.enText: He failed to mention that he was the one who started the fight.
don't mention it

data.chText: （别人道谢时回答）不客气
data.enText: used as a polite answer when sb has thanked you for sth

data.chText: “多谢你帮忙。”“不用客气。”
data.enText: ‘Thanks for all your help.’ ‘Don't mention it.’
not to mention

data.chText: 更不用说；且不说
data.enText: used to introduce extra information and emphasize what you are saying

data.chText: 他在这个国家有两座大房子，更别提他在法国的别墅了。
data.enText: He has two big houses in this country, not to mention his villa in France.

data.chText: 提及；说起；写上一笔
data.enText: an act of referring to sb/sth in speech or writing

data.chText: 他根本没提她的工作。
data.enText: He made no mention of her work.

data.chText: 报纸对这场音乐会只字未提。
data.enText: The concert didn't even get a mention in the newspapers.

data.chText: 理查德对我们帮助很大，理应被特别提一提。
data.enText: Richard deserves (a) special mention for all the help he gave us.

data.text: mention ♦ refer to ♦ cite ♦ quote ♦ allude to

data.chText: 以上各词均含写到、说到、谈及或举例说明之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to write or speak about sb/sth, often in order to give an example or prove sth.
mention

data.chText: 指提到、写到、说到，尤指未给出详细信息：
data.enText: to write or speak about sth/sb, especially without giving much information

data.chText: 没人跟我提过这事。
data.enText: Nobody mentioned anything to me about it.
refer to sb/sth

data.chText: 指提到、谈及、说起：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to mention or speak about sb/sth

data.chText: 我答应过再不提这事了。
data.enText: I promised not to refer to the matter again.
cite

data.chText: 指提及（原因）、举出（示例）证明：
data.enText: ( formal ) to mention sth as a reason or an example, or in order to support what you are saying

data.chText: 他提到繁重的工作负荷是导致他累垮的原因。
data.enText: He cited his heavy workload as the reason for his breakdown.
quote

data.chText: 指举例说明：
data.enText: to mention an example of sth to support what you are saying

data.chText: 你能否给我举例说明一下发生这事的情况？
data.enText: Can you quote me an instance of when this happened?

data.chText: 用cite还是quote？
cite可指提及原因或举出示例，但quote只用于举例：
data.enText: You can cite reasons or examples, but you can only quote examples.
He quoted his heavy workload as the reason for his breakdown.

data.chText: cite较quote正式，常用于较正式的场合中，如说明法律案件。
data.enText: Cite is a more formal word than quote and is often used in more formal situations, for example in descriptions of legal cases.
cite or quote?
allude to sb/sth

data.chText: 指间接提到、暗指、影射：
data.enText: ( formal ) to mention sth in an indirect way

data.chText: 这个问题在以往的讨论中已经间接提及。
data.enText: The problem had been alluded to briefly in earlier discussions.
to mention/refer to/cite/quote/allude to sb/sth as sb/sth
commonly/frequently/often mentioned/referred to/cited/quoted/alluded to
to mention/refer to/allude to sb/sth briefly/casually/in passing
the example mentioned/referred to/cited/quoted/alluded to above/earlier/previously
to mention/refer to/cite/quote a(n) example/instance/case of sth

simple_means.memory_skill: ment 头脑，智力 + ion 表动作 → 有思考 → 提到，论及

ex.chText: 其中的一些解决方案在他的总结里提到了。
ex.enText: Some of the solutions were mentioned in his summary.

ex.chText: 你和她说起过这个想法吗？
ex.enText: Did you mention the idea to her?

synonyms.bx: 指提及、写到某人或某事时，通常一带而过，不涉及太多细节。

ex.chText: 这个故事影射她不愿和别人谈论的过去。
ex.enText: The story alludes to her past that she wouldn't like to discuss with others.

synonyms.bx: 指间接提起某人或某事。

ex.chText: 他们将永远不再提起那件事。
ex.enText: They would never refer to/mention that matter again.

ex.chText: 在其自传中，她偶尔提及她不幸的学生时代。
ex.enText: In her autobiography, she occasionally refers to/mentions her unhappy schooldays.

synonyms.bx: 尤指简短地提起或谈及某人或某事，常可与 mention 换用。

d: to phr. v. 提到，谈到

data.enText: don't mention it

data.chText: （别人道谢时回答）不客气
data.enText: used as a polite answer when sb has thanked you for sth

data.chText: “多谢你帮忙。”“不用客气。”
data.enText: ‘Thanks for all your help.’ ‘Don't mention it.’
not to mention

data.chText: 更不用说；且不说
data.enText: used to introduce extra information and emphasize what you are saying

data.chText: 他在这个国家有两座大房子，更别提他在法国的别墅了。
data.enText: He has two big houses in this country, not to mention his villa in France.

example: although he didn't win the prize he did get special mention

tr: a short note recognizing a source of information or of a quoted passage
example: the student's essay failed to list several important citations
the acknowledgments are usually printed at the front of a book
the article includes mention of similar clinical cases

tr: a remark that calls attention to something or someone
example: she made frequent mention of her promotion
there was no mention of it
the speaker made several references to his wife
She observed that his presentation took up too much time
They noted that it was a fine day to go sailing
he was cited for his outstanding achievements
His name was mentioned in connection with the invention

value.def: If you mention something, you say something about it, usually briefly.

example.ex: She did not mention her mother's absence...
example.tran: 她并没有说起她母亲不在场的事。

example.ex: I may not have mentioned it to her...
example.tran: 我可能没跟她提过这件事。

example.ex: I had mentioned that I didn't really like contemporary music...
example.tran: 我说过，我其实并不喜欢当代音乐。

example.ex: She shouldn't have mentioned how heavy the dress was...
example.tran: 她本不该说起这条裙子有多沉。

example.ex: I felt as though I should mention it as an option.
example.tran: 我觉得我好像应该把它作为一种选择提出来。

value.def: A mention is a reference to something or someone.

example.ex: The statement made no mention of government casualties...
example.tran: 声明里没有提及政府方面的伤亡情况。

example.ex: At the community centre, mention of funds produces pained looks.
example.tran: 在社区中心一提到资金问题，大家就会愁眉不展。

value.def: If someone is mentioned in writing, a reference is made to them by name, often to criticize or praise something that they have done.

example.ex: I was absolutely outraged that I could be even mentioned in an article of this kind...
example.tran: 我大为恼火，我的名字居然出现在这种文章里面。

example.ex: As for your father, he won't be mentioned in my will.
example.tran: 至于你父亲，我的遗嘱里不会提到他的名字。

example.ex: ...Brigadier Ferguson was mentioned in the report as being directly responsible.
example.tran: 弗格森准将作为直接负责人在报道中被提及。

value.tran: （在文章中）提到，谈及(某人的名字)

value.def: If someone is mentioned as a candidate for something such as a job, it is suggested that they might become a candidate.

example.ex: His appointment is a complete surprise — he has never been mentioned as a front runner...
example.tran: 他的任命完全出人意料——他从来都不是呼声最高的候选人。

example.ex: Her name has been mentioned as a favoured leadership candidate.
example.tran: 提到她的名字时，说她是领导职位的热门候选人。

value.def: A special or honourable mention is formal praise that is given for an achievement that is very good, although not usually the best of its kind.

example.ex: So many people have helped me with this book that it is hard to pick out the few for special mention.
example.tran: 帮助我完成本书的人数太多，难以从中选出几位特别致谢。

value.def: People sometimes say 'don't mention it' as a polite reply to someone who has just thanked them for doing something.
You use not to mention when you want to add extra information which emphasizes the point that you are making.

example.ex: The audience, not to mention the bewildered cast, were not amused...
example.tran: 观众们并没有觉得好笑，更不用说那些一头雾水的演员了。

example.ex: It was both deliberate and malicious, not to mention clever.
example.tran: 这件事是处心积虑、早有预谋的，更不用说其手段的高明。

value.boxu_tran: mention 指简单地说起某事，尤其是以前没有说过的事，例如，He mentioned that he might go to New York (他提到过可能会去纽约)。comment 则是指发表评论或意见，例如，Mr Cook has not commented on these reports (库克先生没有对这些报道发表评论)，I was wondering whether you had any comments (不知道你是否有什么意见)。remark 指随意地说出自己的想法或者注意到的事情，例如，Visitors remark on how well the children look (前来探望的人说起孩子们看上去有多健康)，General Sutton's remarks about the conflict (萨顿将军对这场冲突的看法)。
value.boxu_usage: If you mention something, you say it, but only briefly, especially when you have not talked about it before. He mentioned that he might go to New York. If you comment on a situation, or make a comment about it, you give your opinion on it. Mr Cook has not commented on these reports... I was wondering whether you had any comments. If you remark on something, or make a remark about it, you say what you think or what you have noticed, often in a casual way. Visitors remark on how well the children look... General Sutton's remarks about the conflict.

partsOfSpeech.dec: a 无 + ment 头脑，智力 + ia 某种病 → 无心智的病 → 智力缺陷
com 共同 + ment 头脑，智力 → 共同思考，述说各自观点 → 评论
comment 评论，评注 + ate 做，造成，使… → 评述；注释
de 去掉 + ment 头脑，智力 + ed 表形容词 → 去掉心智 → 失去理智的
ment 头脑，智力 + al …的 → 智力的；精神的
ment 头脑，智力 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 心智活动
ment 头脑，智力 + ion 表动作 → 有思考 → 提到，论及
ment 头脑，智力 + or 表人 → 精神上的指导人 → 导师
